rise to the fact that universities
have "lagged behind (national
cost increases in other fields)

and faster (than other costs in

The Johns Hopkins Reserve
OfficerS' Training Corps has received three officers in the normal rotation of military personnel. Joining the Hopkins' Cadre

near-by Fort Meade after graduation from the Military Academy in 1934.

"In general I would say this
Year's program was very successful," commented 1958 Orientation Week Chairman Charlie
Ginsberg concerning the recently
completed
get-acquainted
period for Homewood freshmen.
In a special News-Letter interview, Ginsberg explained that
"comments were mostly favorable" and "included many helpful suggestions for next year." .
In a report prepared for
presentation at next week's Student Council meeting, Ginsberg
emphasized faculty and administration satisfaction with this
Year's program. "Dr. Morrill was
well pleased and complimented
the student leaders, especially
those with no faculty advisors,
for their fine work," he stated.
Boring?

outside observers as suggesting
a shortening of the overall program in general and the Shriver
assemblies in particular. Freshmen were "apparently bored"
With several of the assemblies
and feel they could be condensed
or even eliminated, Ginsberg
noted.
According to Ginsberg, both
the math refresher and the
study skills classes were "quite
successful." "Some even felt they
should have the chance to attend both, and one comment
suggested a foreign language refresher for those taking the lan-

guage placement tests,” he
added, noting that tests were
given in modern languages and
chemistry for the placement of
students.
Want Hot Food
The rotation system by which
each freshman group received
one hot lunch in the dormitory
cafeteria met with great approval and even gave rise to
many suggestions for enlarging
this to provide daily hot lunches
for all freshmen.
"I spoke to Dr. Morrill about
this and he pointed out that it
would be almost impossible due
to the close schedule of the program and the fact that there
would be a long wait in line to
get the food," Ginsberg explained.

and banquet were very successful," Ginsberg added, also praising the speech of University

Today begins my fifth year of writing this column, and what an

anti-proton, for instance, and the anti-neutron, and high-low
split, and Brigitte Bardot!
In these five years it has also been discovered that American
smokers like two kinds of cigarettes—filter and non-filter. The
Philip Morris Company makes both kinds. I mention the
Philip Morris Company because they pay me to mention the
Philip Morris Company. They sponsor this celumn. I write it
and then they give me money. Then I take the money and pay
my grocer, my butcher, my gardener, and my four madrigal
singers. In this way full employment is maintained and we
avoid a repetition of the Panic of 1873 when bread riots killed
over 98 million people in Muncie,Indiana,and millions of others
were reduced to ghost-writing Ph. D. theses to keep body and
soul together.

Morris, a mild natural blend, flavorful, fresh, and thoroughly

cheer, I walk forward with my finger outstretched and the first

ONCE MORE UNTO THE BREACH
Today begins my fifth year of writing this column, and what an
eventful five years it has been! What things have these old eyes
not seen! What great discoveries have rocked the world—the
anti-proton, for instance, and the anti-neutron, and high-low
split, and Brigitte Bardot!
In these five years it has also been discovered that American
smokers like two kinds of cigarettes—filter and non-filter. The
Philip Morris Company makes both kinds. I mention the
Philip Morris Company because they pay me to mention the
Philip Morris Company. They sponsor this celumn. I write it
and then they give me money. Then I take the money and pay
my grocer, my butcher, my gardener, and my four madrigal
singers. In this way full employment is maintained and we
avoid a repetition of the Panic of 1873 when bread riots killed
over 98 million people in Muncie,Indiana,and millions of others
were reduced to ghost-writing Ph. D. theses to keep body and
soul together.
But enough of gloom. Let us get back to cheerful subjects,
like the products
of the Philip Morris Company. For those of
You who wish filter cigarettes there is Marlboro, which now,
more than ever, gives you a lot to like—a brand new improved
filter and a wonderful flavor that comes breezing right through.
For those of you who
wish non-filter cigarettes, there is Philip
Morris, a mild natural blend, flavorful, fresh, and thoroughly
agreeable. For those of you who can't decide between filters or
non-filters but have an affinity for packages, I should like to
Point out that both Marlboro and Philip Morris come in both
the crusliproof
Flip-Top Box and the good old-fashioned Soft
Pack,and you will surely want several of each for your collection.
Speaking for myself, I smoke both Marlboro and Philip
Morris in both packs. What I do is make kind of a fun thing
out of it. In my
bedroom I have four signs, one on each wall,
Which say in turn: "PHILIP MORRIS—SOFT PACK",
"PHILIP MORRIS—FLIP-TOP," "MARLBORO—SOFT
PACK" and "MARLBORO—FLIP-TOP". When I get up in
the morning I put on a blindfold and then my faithful cat Rover
Spins me around six times and then, with many a laugh and
cheer, I walk forward with my finger outstretched and the first
Sign I touch is the cigarette I smoke that day!
